definition: to harness (a horse to a cart)

to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Rack and pinion telescoping section ensures proper load alignment.
sentences.chinese: 齿轮齿条套车部件，保证荷载同轴。

sentences.english: And Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.
sentences.chinese: 所罗门有套车的马四万，还有马兵一万二千。

sentences.english: You who live in Lachish, harness the team to the chariot.
sentences.chinese: 拉吉的居民哪，要用快马套车。

sentences.english: Independent variable speed drives on telescoping section.
sentences.chinese: 套车部件的自变数速度驱动器。

definition: to pull a carriage (of draft animal)
to escort (goods) during transportation/to delay unloading (a truck, train etc)
